data.title: Alabama's Eddie Lacy has mixed results at workout
data.description: . . Former Alabama running back Eddie Lacy didn't run at the NFL Scouting Combine or the Crimson Tide's pro day because of a hamstring injury. He worked out for scouts in Tuscaloosa, Ala., on Thursday with mixed results. NFL.com's Bucky Brooks reported Lacy ran the 40-yard dash in 4.57 and 4.60 seconds. Lacy reportedly posted times of 4.58 and 4.62 at the Senior Bowl. Lacy flashed outstanding talent as a runner and receiver, but lack of stamina is definitely a concern, Bucky tweeted. Struggle...

data.title: Noonan gets first start on frosty day at Wrigley
data.description: CHICAGO – The big news in Wrigley Field is actually happening in Daytona Beach, where Cubs top prospect Jorge Soler brandished a bat during a benches-clearing brawl. Back here in Chicago, the only thing I’m brandishing is a muffler. It’s not balmy out there. A day ago, the Cubs postponed their game with the Brewers five hours before the first pitch. They knew it would be a miserably cold, wet night. It’s still cold but mostly drizzling, with high temperatures expected to stay in the low 40s t...

data.title: Report: Mets ‘Monitoring’ Sluggers Giancarlo Stanton, Carlos Gonzalez
data.description: Giancarlo Stanton (Photo by Marc Serota/Getty Images) . NEW YORK (CBSNewYork) – The Mets’ future is as bright as it has been in a long, long time. But the age-old question remains: Do you keep blue-chip prospects and see them through, or do you trade them for proven talent? The Amazin’s have that question to ponder. New York is lacking power in its lineup, and it’s no secret that it could use a big bat — optimally an outfielder — to slot in the middle of the order in between David Wright and ...

data.title: PFT Live: Mike Glennon, Patriots talk with Tom Curran
data.description: Getty ImagesThere are no shortage of opinions floating around about the quarterbacks in this year’s draft class, with everyone picking their favorite from a crop that’s short on sure things. For some team, Mike Glennon of North Carolina State might be just the guy they’re looking for. We’ll try to find out if any team has given Glennon that impression when he joins Mike Florio on Thursday’s edition of PFT Live for a conversation about how he’s preparing for the big day later this month. Flori...

data.title: Selig won't meet San Jose mayor about A's
data.description: Bud Selig rejects meeting with mayor . Updated: April 11, 2013, 11:46 AM ET. Associated PressSAN JOSE, Calif. -- San Jose mayor Chuck Reed's request to sit down with Major League Baseball commissioner Bud Selig to discuss the Oakland A's pursuit of a San Jose ballpark has been rejected, a newspaper reported. In a response to Reed's April 2 request for a personal meeting, Selig said Reed should instead talk to Robert Starkey, a sports consultant who worked with the MLB on stadium issues for th...

data.title: Red Wings G Jimmy Howard says he's 'really, really close' to signing contract extension
data.description: DETROIT - Detroit Red Wings goaltender Jimmy Howard says he's really, really close to signing a contract extension. Howard declined to give details Thursday morning and the team says it has nothing to announce. He is in the second season of a two-year, $4.5 million deal. The 29-year-old Howard is the first goalie in franchise history to win at least 35 games in each of his first three full seasons. He is 16-12-4 this year, his fourth full season in net, entering a possibly pivotal game Thursd...

data.title: James Harrison to meet with Cincinnati Bengals
data.description: . . James Harrison might wind up staying in the AFC North, but not with the Baltimore Ravens, as many expected early in the free agency process. Harrison is visiting the Cincinnati Bengals on Thursday, according to NFL.com's Ian Rapoport. The story was first reported by USA Today Sports. . Free-agent tracker . Harrison, 34, gambled and lost when he refused to take a pay cut to stay with the Pittsburgh Steelers for another season. The Steelers reportedly were offering more than $4 million, a t...

data.title: Jags GM content sticking with No. 2 pick
data.description: Jags eye 2 players for No. 2 pick . Two weeks ahead of his first draft as Jacksonville Jaguars general manager, Dave Caldwell said that although he could trade down, the franchise will be happy to stay at No. 2. . We would be open to both [staying put or trading down], he said. There is a player there at two that we're going to draft and that's going to make us better, we feel good about that, and we have a consensus here from our personnel staff and our coaching staff. It would have to be th...
